title: ipi-ripng
description: Data model for IPI RIPng Configuration and Operational state

ipi-ripng:ripng.description: Top level container for RIPng Configuration

config.description: RIPng Debug Configuration Data

options.description: This attribute enables debugging for RIPng

state.description: RIPng Debug Operational Data

options.description: This attribute enables debugging for RIPng

terminal-debug-status.description: This attribute describes the RIPng terminal debug status

name.description: The textual name of the interface

config.description: Interface RIPng Configuration Data

name.description: The textual name of the interface

enabled.description: Use this attribute to perform the router rip action on the interface

split-horizon.description: Use this attribute to perform the split-horizon action on the interface. Deleting this attribute would set the split-horizon to poisoned reverse which is the default value.

metric-offset.description: Use this attribute to perform the metric-offset action on the interface

state.description: Interface RIPng Operational Data

name.description: The textual name of the interface

enabled.description: Use this attribute to perform the router rip action on the interface

split-horizon.description: Use this attribute to perform the split-horizon action on the interface. Deleting this attribute would set the split-horizon to poisoned reverse which is the default value.

metric-offset.description: Use this attribute to perform the metric-offset action on the interface

config.description: RIPng Instance Configuration Data

passive-interfaces.description: Use this attribute to block RIP broadcast on the interface

static-routes.description: Use this attribute to configure static RIP routes

aggregate-prefixes.description: Use this attribute to configure aggregate prefixes

distance.description: Use this attribute to set the administrative distance. The administrative distance is a feature used by the routers to select the path when there are two or more different routes to the same destination from two different routing protocols. A smaller administrative distance indicating a more reliable protocol

default-metric.description: Use this attribute to specify the metrics to be assigned to redistributed routers

originate-default-route.description: Use this attribute to add default routes to the RIP updates

enable-cisco-metric-behavior.description: Use this attribute to enable the metric update consistent with Cisco

receive-buffer-size.description: Use this attribute to run-time configure the RIP UDP receive-buffer size

ripng-enabled.description: Use this attribute to enable the router instance

config.description: Configuration Data for RIPng Offset Lists

direction.description: Use this attribute to decide the type of packets to which the offset list is applied

access-list-name.description: Use this attribute to add an offset to in and out metrics to routes learned through RIP. This command specifies the offset value that is added to the routing metric. When the networks match the access list the offset is applied to the metrics. No change occurs if the offset value is zero

metric.description: This attribute describes the metric used for offset list

direction.description: Use this attribute to decide the type of packets to which the distribute list is applied

access-list-name.description: Use this attribute to filter incoming or outgoing route updates using an access list or a prefix list. You can filter out incoming or outgoing route updates using an access list or a prefix list. If you do not specify the name of the interface, the filter will be applied to all the interfaces.
